address: LUV Contemporary Art, 18-4, Bukchon-ro 7-gil, Jongno-gu, Seoul, Korea
description: LUV Contemporary Art is hosting the solo exhibition "3 PALETTE" by artist-in-residence Jackson Sim, and launching 20 new works from a new series. Jackson Sim, who does not hesitate to express messages that reflect the contemporary era and sublimate pure art into popular art, is not satisfied, but explores new aesthetic fields, presenting a new series in each exhibition. The artist often discovers new methods of art from her little daughter, and this time, while coloring with her child, she felt the beauty of unexpected shapes created by the mixing of different colors, which led to the creation of the "Palette" series. Jackson Sim sees traces of change, and different colors are mixed together to form beautiful shapes. The blocks of pigment and the free-flowing mixed colors are reminiscent of the palette, an artistic tool. The artist presents three different forms, seeking the reversal between tool and work, and the accidental effects of pigment flow, entanglement, mixing, and dynamic materials created by the artist's instinctive sense stand out. The artist no longer seeks philosophical insights or explanations from the audience, but immerses herself in the aesthetic composition, gradually approaching lyrical abstract forms. Cartoon characters from popular culture, reinterpreted with strong colors and improvisational lines, spread like a scent in the air in<Air and Rolling Roses >, but are ultimately reduced to colors in the palette, erasing even the smallest form that makes the characters recognizable. It happens. The colors of the real world observed by the artist are transformed into a text composed of words and color names, a format that contains fundamental questions about the nature of things. The artist reproduces objects seen by the naked eye on the canvas with colors, subverting the concept between our perceived reality and color. Here we discover that the color of an object cannot be explained in one way. Realizing that the definition of color promised by society (e.g. apples are red, milk is white) has been simplified, we expand our understanding of the essence. The author uses the masses as the source of aesthetics and cheerfully expresses the positivity of capitalism. Jackson Shim's sincere wishes, muse and innocent code return to the essence of painting, but we can find traces of our favorite innocent existence in this ecstatic flow of colors. We hope that when the audience sees Jackson Shim's palette, they can remember their own essence and desires and find their own colors.

address: 120 Sapyeong-daero 53-gil, 반포1동 Seocho-gu, Seoul, South Korea
40 Pyeongchang 30-gil, Pyeongchang-dong, Jongno-gu, Seoul, South Korea
23, Eulji-ro, Jung-gu station la plus proche : Euljiro 1-ga, Seoul 04523 South Korea
description: The Grevin Museum was founded in Paris, France in 1882. It is a world-renowned wax museum with a history of 133 years. It is the seventh most famous tourist destination in Paris after the Louvre, Versailles, Eiffel Tower and other tourist attractions. The combination of the long history and the ingenious works of the craftsmen shows us not only wax figures, but also a kind of face-to-face with contemporary celebrities and understanding historical events through wax figures. To be precise, it is a cultural field. sublimation. In July 2015, the Grevan Museum will be established in Seoul. It is a cultural heritage building with historical and architectural significance. It is a 4-story building with an investment of 18 billion yuan in the "Seoul City Hall Euljiro Branch Building". It is the largest in Asia. wax museum. You can learn about Korea's past and present, history and culture, Hallyu and K-POP, Paris and Seoul, and other representative Korean venues with various themes. The wax figures are so lifelike that it is difficult to distinguish the true from the false. You can take photos at will, and the seven Grevin experience halls are constructed through science and technology such as gestures, movements, and sounds. Unlike the exhibition, you can directly participate in the experience activities and experience the experience halls in it. Bring you infinite shock. At the same time, it is also a large-scale experience hall that combines entertainment and education. The meteorological space can be directly viewed through digital images, which is a two-way experience hall.

Jong Ie Nara Paper Art Museum
address: 166, Jangchungdan-ro, Jung-gu | floor 3, Jongienara Bldg., Seoul 04606, South Korea
description: The National Paper Museum located in the center of Seoul, together with the excellent relics of Korean paper culture, excavates and collects modern and creative paper culture and art works, and displays them to publicize the history and development status of Korean paper culture at home and abroad.
